'''''Tolkien's Hobbit: A Book of 20 Postcards''''' is a book containing twenty postcards with illustrations inspired by ''[[The Hobbit]]''. 

==Contents==

#[[John Howe]]: ''An Unexpected Party''
#Gerd Renshof and Ron Ploeg: ''Rough Steps Going up the Lonely Mountain''
#[[Alan Lee]]: ''Captured by Spiders''
#[[Roger Garland]]: ''Gandalf''
#[[Alan Lee]]: ''Bridge to Rivendell''
#Capucine Mazille: ''Smaug''
#[[Ted Nasmith]]: ''Eagles to the Rescue''
#Gerd Renshof and Ron Ploeg: ''The Trolls''
#[[John Howe]]: ''A Hobbit Dwelling''
#[[Alan Lee]]: ''Thorin's Map''
#[[Pauline Baynes]]: ''Barrels out of Bond''
#[[Cor Blok]]: ''The Game of Riddles''
#[[Alan Lee]]: ''Into the Mountains''
#[[David Wenzel]]: ''An Unexpected Party''
#Capucine Mazille: ''In the House of Beorn''
#[[Alan Lee]]: ''Thorin's Arrival''
#[[John Howe]]: ''Gandalf''
#Capucine Mazille: ''The Battle of Five Armies''
#[[Alan Lee]]: ''View over Mirkwood''
#Gerd Renshof and Ron Ploeg: ''Bilbo Flies on Eagle's Wings''

==From the back==

A book of 20 postcards featuring a selection of artists' interpretations of JRR Tolkien's enduring classic work ''The Hobbit''.
